required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Human BCMA Targeted T Cells Injection Therapy for BCMA-positive Relapsed/Refractory Multiple Myeloma
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of Human BCMA Targeted T Cells Injection for Subjects With BCMA-positive Relapsed/Refractory Multiple Myeloma

collaborator.agency: First Affiliated Hospital of Wenzhou Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the safety and efficacy of Human BCMA Targeted T Cells Injection for the treatment of BCMA-positive relapsed/refractory multiple myeloma. Patients will be given a conditioning chemotherapy regimen of fludarabine and cyclophosphamide followed by a single infusion of BCMA CAR+ T cells.

detailed_description.textblock: Participants with BCMA-positive relapsed/refractory multiple myeloma can participate if all eligibility criteria are met. Tests required to determine eligibility include disease assessments, a physical exam, Electrocardiograph, CT/MRI/PET, and blood draws. Participants receive chemotherapy prior to the infusion of BCMA CAR+ T cells. After the infusion, participants will be followed for side effects and effect of BCMA CAR+ T cells. Study procedures may be performed while hospitalized.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with treatment-related adverse events as assessed by NCI-CTCAE 5.0

secondary_outcome.measure: Concentration of Anti-BCMA CAR T Cells in blood
Concentration of Anti-BCMA CAR T Cells in bone marrow
Pharmacodynamics (Content of clonal plasma cells in bone marrow)
Negative proportion of minimal residual disease (MRD)

arm_group.arm_group_label: Human BCMA targeted T Cells Injection
arm_group.description: A single infusion of anti-BCMA CAR transduced T cells administered intravenously at a target dose of 3 to 9 x 10^6 CAR T +cells/kg. The classic "3+3" dose escalation will be applied.

intervention.intervention_name: Human BCMA targeted T Cells Injection
intervention.description: Autologous genetically modified anti-BCMA CAR transduced T cells
intervention.arm_group_label: Human BCMA targeted T Cells Injection

facility.name: The First Affiliated Hospital of Wenzhou Medical University
